titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hartt School Community Division records ARCH058
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Sean Parke in Dec. 2015; updated Jan. 2016 by Sean Parke; updated by Prachi Bhandutia, Dec. 2018; updated and revised by Prachi Bhandutia and Sean Parke Fall 2019.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-10 13:52:02 -0400.

change.item: Merged Marketing Accessions from 2017, 2018, and 2019 into one series called Marketing Materials. Split "Acc. I Unknown" primarily into subject files series and photographs series, with some files moved to the marketing materials series. At this time left two dance accessions separate.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

dao.xlink:title: Digital Hartt School Community Division collection

daodesc.p: Digital Hartt School Community Division collection

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Some of the materials in this collection, primarily photographs, have been digitized and are available at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu/explore/explore/?c=allcollections:67). Access is limited to the University of Hartford Campus.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Hartt School, under various names, has always served both traditionally-aged college students and members of the larger Greater Hartford Community. The Community Division has a reputation for providing high quality musical education for both children and adults. Today's Community Division was formerly called the Julius Hartt School of Music and the "Non-Collegiate School of Music."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2015, the call number was changed from HL to ARCH058.

Original processors unknown (likely Ethel Bacon and/or Margaret Mair); reprocessed by Sean Parke, 2016 Jan.; Acc. 2016-03-02-01 (Hartt Community Division Dance department records - partially processed) and 2016-11-01-02 (Hartford Ballet and School of HB photographs) processed by Sean Parke, 2016; Acc. 2017-09-14-01 (Marketing materials) processed by Amanda Talbot; Acc. 2018-07-11-01, Prachi Bhandutia, 2018 Dec; Acc. 2019-08-26-02 and general reprocessing in collection, Prachi Bhandutia, 2019 Sep.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains minutes, brochures, concert programs, photographs, accreditation/self-study reports, and other material documenting the Hartt School Community Division.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is currently arranged into five series with two additional accessions which have not yet been fully processed and merged into the collection. The series are: I. Marketing Materials, 1962-2018; II. Subject Files, 1936-2013; III. Photographs, 1953-1976; IV. Recordings, 2015; V. Duplicates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of marketing materials including, brochures, pamphlets, programs and other public relations materials used to promote the Hartt School Community Division from 1962-2018, with the bulk of the materials from 2001-2018. Also included are oversized posters and two buttons.

fileplan.p: Consists of two buttons which read "I danced at Hartt today"

processinfo.p: Reprocessed by Sean Parke in Jan. 2016.
